messageBody:
Terry Smithwick skrev:
> Please don't bottom-post. Having to scan my way down past
> something I've already read, in order to find out if there's
> anything new, is a tedious waste of time.

I much prefer to have a continuous text in front of me,
with each addition beginning at the end of what it adds to.
Having to jerk around by first reading, then scrolling down
a looong way to find the end of the trail, then scroll up to
find the beginning of the original post, then read downwards,
then scroll up past what I just read, then read down past what
I just scrolled up, then again scroll up past what I just read is
a waste of brain cells. Everyone agrees that a book where
successive sections were printed *before* each other would be
unreadable. Email isn't any different, since our brains think
of time and space in a linear and not a zig-zag fashion.
That may say more about our brains than about time and space,
but so it is.

> But by anything you might want to believe in, by all means
> don't anyone intersperse posts.

Keeping a comment close to what it comments upon is a Good Thing.
That's why Edward Tufte prefers margin notes to footnotes.
Moreover it saves typing/cutting/pasting in order to show
what you're referring to.

Of course citing more of the mail you are replying to than what
is needed/relevant to get the context of what you have to say
is also a Bad Thing, though we err on that out of laziness and
fatigue. If we didn't and used message threading the issue
of top/bottom posting wouldn't arise.

...but let's just agree to disagree.

/BP 8^)>
--

à la langue de s'arrêter; les langues ni le soleil

c'est qu'elles meurent." (Victor Hugo)
